snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton sought to reassure Europe on Saturday that the United States was not abandoning its partners across the Atlantic.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton seek to reassure Europe that, despite budget cuts and the coming withdrawal from the Continent of about 6,000 to 7,000 American troops, the United States is not abandoning its partners across the Atlantic.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and STEVEN ERLANGER

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton sought to reassure Europe on Saturday that the United States was not abandoning its partners across the Atlantic.

headline.seo: Panetta and Clinton Reassure Europe on Defense
headline.main: Panetta and Clinton Seek to Reassure Europe on Defense
headline.print_headline: Panetta and Clinton Seek to Reassure Europe on Defense
